alert.note: Alert for Yuma County (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 09 at 7:26PM MDT by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Yuma County through 800 PM MDT... At 725 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Eckley, or 10 miles east of Yuma, moving east at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Eckley around 730 PM MDT. This includes Highway 385 near mile marker 247. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
